about.summary: Python Materials Genomics is a robust materials analysis code that defines core object representations for structures and molecules with support for many electronic structure codes. It is currently the core analysis code powering the Materials Project (https://materialsproject.org).

Python Materials Genomics is a robust materials analysis code that defines core object representations for structures and molecules with support for many electronic structure codes. It is currently the core analysis code powering the Materials Project (https://materialsproject.org).

name: pymatgen

about.summary: Python Materials Genomics is a robust materials analysis code that defines core object representations for structures and molecules with support for many electronic structure codes. It is currently the core analysis code powering the Materials Project (https://materialsproject.org).

Python Materials Genomics is a robust materials analysis code that defines core object representations for structures and molecules with support for many electronic structure codes. It is currently the core analysis code powering the Materials Project (https://materialsproject.org).

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "pymatgen" %}
{% set version = "2024.2.23" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/pymatgen-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 48764e1bdf8d6b0209b650a96c86947b73d41bc7d2cc4ff13b2ac54dd1c308eb

build:
  skip: true  # [py<39]
  entry_points:
    - pmg = pymatgen.cli.pmg:main
    - feff_plot_cross_section = pymatgen.cli.feff_plot_cross_section:main
    - feff_plot_dos = pymatgen.cli.feff_plot_dos:main
    - get_environment = pymatgen.cli.get_environment:main
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv --no-deps --no-build-isolation
  number: 0

requirements:
  build:
    - python                                 # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - cross-python_{{ target_platform }}     # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - cython                                 # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - numpy                                  # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - {{ compiler('c') }}
  host:
    - python
    - cython >=0.29.23
    - setuptools >=65.0.0
    - numpy
    - pip
  run:
    - python
    - matplotlib-base >=1.5
    - monty >=2024.2.2
    - networkx >=2.2
    - palettable >=3.1.1
    - pandas
    - plotly >=4.5.0
    - pybtex
    - requests
    - ruamel.yaml >=0.17.0
    - scipy >=1.5.0
    - spglib >=2.0.2
    - sympy
    - tabulate
    - tqdm
    - uncertainties >=3.1.4
    - joblib
    - {{ pin_compatible('numpy') }}

test:
  imports:
    - pymatgen
    - pymatgen.alchemy
    - pymatgen.analysis
    - pymatgen.analysis.chemenv
    - pymatgen.analysis.chemenv.coordination_environments
    - pymatgen.analysis.chemenv.coordination_environments.coordination_geometries_files
    # - pymatgen.analysis.chemenv.coordination_environments.strategy_files
    - pymatgen.analysis.chemenv.utils
    - pymatgen.analysis.cost
    - pymatgen.analysis.diffraction
    - pymatgen.analysis.elasticity
    - pymatgen.analysis.hhi
    - pymatgen.analysis.pourbaix_diagram
    - pymatgen.apps
    - pymatgen.apps.battery
    - pymatgen.apps.borg
    - pymatgen.cli
    - pymatgen.command_line
    - pymatgen.core
    - pymatgen.electronic_structure
    - pymatgen.entries
    - pymatgen.io
    - pymatgen.io.abinit
    - pymatgen.io.feff
    - pymatgen.io.lammps
    - pymatgen.io.vasp
    - pymatgen.ext.matproj
    - pymatgen.optimization
    - pymatgen.analysis.phase_diagram
    - pymatgen.analysis.structure_prediction
    - pymatgen.symmetry
    - pymatgen.transformations
    - pymatgen.util
    - pymatgen.vis
  commands:
    - pip check
    - pmg --help
    - feff_plot_cross_section --help
    - feff_plot_dos --help
    - get_environment --help
  requires:
    - pip

about:
  home: https://pymatgen.org
  summary: Python Materials Genomics is a robust materials analysis code that defines core object representations for structures and molecules with support for many electronic structure codes. It is currently the core analysis code powering the Materials Project (https://materialsproject.org).
  doc_url: https://pythonhosted.org/pymatgen/
  license: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - jan-janssen
    - shyuep
    - mkhorton
